items.content: Five children have been injured hurt after jumping castle became untethered in Sydney's west.

items.title: Five children hurt after jumping castle became untethered in Sydney
items.standfirst: Five children have suffered minor injuries hurt after a jumping castle blew away in Sydney.
items.content: Five children have suffered minor injuries hurt after a jumping castle blew away in Sydney.The device detached and blew over a fence next to where it was tethered in Kelvin Park Drive, Bradfield near Liverpool.Emergency services were called at 9.35am .Three nine-year-olds, as well as a 12 and 13-year-old were assessed by NSW Ambulance paramedics for non-life-threatening injuries, they said.They were taken to hospital in stable conditions.SafeWork NSW are there, NSW Police said.According to the BOM, wind gusts of up to 74km/h have been recorded in nearby Canterbury, and 89km/h at Sydney Airport.

items.standfirst: Emergency services were called to a property in Bradfield following reports a jumping castle had flown into the air with people onboard.
items.content: Emergency services were called to a property in Bradfield following reports a jumping castle had flown into the air with people onboard.

ai_summary: Five children were injured in Sydney after a jumping castle incident.

items.standfirst: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.
items.content: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

ai_summary: Experts warn against using location sharing tools to control victims.
The NSW coroner found Paul Thijssen used tools to track Lilie James.
The tools are readily available and used in everyday life.
The article discusses the misuse of technology in domestic violence.
The focus is on the control of victim-survivors.

clusters.title: Concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver
clusters.neutral_headline: Concerns Raised About Cosmetic Filler Breakdown Issues

items.title: Concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver
items.standfirst: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.
items.content: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.

ai_summary: Lana is raising concerns about long-term side effects from fillers.
The article discusses the risks of cosmetic injectable procedures.
The filler may not break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver.
More people are undergoing cosmetic injectable treatments.
The article highlights potential complications from fillers.

clusters.neutral_headline: Europe Does Not Find Russian Aggression Humorous

items.title: Europe doesn't find talk of Russian aggression as funny as Putin does
items.standfirst: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

The article suggests that Putin's perspective differs.

clusters.title: The power dynamic between Labor and mining has shifted
clusters.neutral_headline: Power Dynamic Shifts Between Labor and Mining Industry

items.title: The power dynamic between Labor and mining has shifted
items.standfirst: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.
items.content: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

ai_summary: The article discusses a shift in the power dynamic.
The shift is between the Labor party and the mining industry.
This week's environmental law reform embodies the shift.
The article focuses on the changing relationship.
The mining industry is a key player.
